benak.tomas.crimemonitor.client.view

Class CrimeMonthHistogramObservationView

  • java.lang.Object
    • View
      • benak.tomas.crimemonitor.client.view.CrimeMonthHistogramObservationView

  • public class CrimeMonthHistogramObservationView
extends View
    A class used to display a single observation in a crime count monthly histogram.

    The observation is displayed using a colored bar, a text label with the month description and a text label with the observed value for that month. The height of the bar is in proportion with the observed value. See the CrimeMonthHistogramFragment documentation for the details about how the bar height is calculated and how the color is assigned to the bar.

    Author:
    Tom
    See Also:
    CrimeMonthHistogramObservation, CrimeMonthHistogramFragment

      • CrimeMonthHistogramObservationView

        public CrimeMonthHistogramObservationView(Context context,
                                  CrimeMonthHistogramObservation observation,
                                  int topCrimeCount,
                                  int barRectPaintColor)
        Constructs a new CrimeMonthHistogramObservationView using a provided context, an observation, the maximum observed value and a bar color.
        Parameters:
        context - the context for this view
        observation - the observation to display
        topCrimeCount - the maximum observed value across the whole crime count monthly histogram
        barRectPaintColor - the bar color

    • Method Detail

      • getMinimumHeight

        public int getMinimumHeight()
        Calculates the minimum height for this view.

        The minimum height calculation takes the label and bar minimum heights into account, along with additional margins between them.

      • getMinimumWidth

        public int getMinimumWidth()
        Calculates the minimum width for this view.

        The minimum width calculation takes the label and bar minimum widths into account.

      • init

        private void init()
        Initializes the view to be prepared to measure and draw itself.

      • onDraw

        protected void onDraw(Canvas canvas)
        Draws the content of this view.

        Uses the previously calculated sizes and positions of the content elements to be drawn.

      • onMeasure

        protected void onMeasure(int widthMeasureSpec,
             int heightMeasureSpec)
        Measures the dimensions of this view.

        The view proposes to be as big as its minimum dimensions requirements are.
